info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 10 at 8:43AM MST until October 10 at 11:45AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of east central, north central, and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in east central Arizona, Gila. In north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai.
* WHEN...Until 1145 AM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick roads and muddy unpaved roads. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain has fallen. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing and a stream gage on the East Verde River has risen 2 to 3 feet. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Corduroy Wash, West Clear Creek, East Branch Squaw Creek, Dry Wash, Toms Creek, Bull Run Creek, Squaw Creek, Clover Creek, Brushy Creek, Bishop Creek, South Prong Sycamore Creek, Davenport Wash, Cold Water Creek, Lime Creek, Red Creek, Sycamore Creek, Professor Creek, West Webber Creek, Horse Creek, New River, Middle Red Creek, Hardscrabble Creek, South Fork Mud Spring Creek, Little Lime Creek, Verde River, Deadman Creek, Ash Spring Creek, Wet Bottom Creek, Mud Spring Creek, Fossil Creek, Houston Creek, Pigeon Creek, Spring Wash and Tangle Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Childs Power Plant, Fossil Creek Day Use Area, Fossil Creek Waterfall, The Toilet Bowl, Strawberry, Table Mountain, Pine, Chalk Mountain, Sunset Mountain, Indian Maiden Falls, Hanging Garden, Pine Mountain Wilderness, Tonto Natural Bridge State Park, Cedar Bench Wilderness, Fossil Springs Wilderness and West Clear Creek Wilderness. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 233 and 251. State Route 87 between mile markers 267 and 280.
This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes and waterfalls on Fossil Creek and Fossil Creek Dam "The Toilet Bowl". - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM MST THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Coconino, AZ; Gila, AZ; Yavapai, AZ
